content:
There are many things to see and do in Cartagena besides enjoying the delicious food. Here are some additional recommendations:

1. Walking tour of the Old Town - This is a great way to explore the historic center of Cartagena and learn about the city's history, architecture, and culture. 2. Visit the Castillo de San Felipe de Barajas - This is a massive fortress built by the Spanish in the 17th century to protect the city from pirate attacks. The castle is open for visitors and offers beautiful views of the city. 3. Take a boat tour of the Rosario Islands - These islands are located off the coast of Cartagena and offer stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and beautiful coral reefs. 4. Visit the Convento de la Popa - This is a beautiful 17th-century convent located on top of a hill overlooking the city. It offers panoramic views of Cartagena and the surrounding area. 5. Explore the Getsemani neighborhood - This is a bohemian neighborhood located just outside the walls of the Old Town. It's known for its street art, live music, and great food. 6. Admire the street art - Cartagena is known for its colorful street art, with beautiful murals and graffiti scattered throughout the city. 7. Sunset at Cafe del Mar - This is a popular bar located on the city walls and offers beautiful views of the sunset over the Caribbean. These are just a few suggestions, but there are many other things to see and do in Cartagena. The city has a vibrant culture and history that is worth exploring, and you'll definitely find something that interests you.
